      • SetupApplication

        public SetupApplication(InfoflowAndroidConfiguration config)
        Creates a new instance of the SetupApplication class
        Parameters:
        config - The data flow configuration to use

      • SetupApplication

        public SetupApplication(String androidJar,
                        String apkFileLocation)
        Creates a new instance of the SetupApplication class
        Parameters:
        androidJar - The path to the Android SDK's "platforms" directory if Soot shall automatically select the JAR file to be used or the path to a single JAR file to force one.
        apkFileLocation - The path to the APK file to be analyzed

      • SetupApplication

        public SetupApplication(String androidJar,
                        String apkFileLocation,
                        soot.jimple.infoflow.ipc.IIPCManager ipcManager)
        Creates a new instance of the SetupApplication class
        Parameters:
        androidJar - The path to the Android SDK's "platforms" directory if Soot shall automatically select the JAR file to be used or the path to a single JAR file to force one.
        apkFileLocation - The path to the APK file to be analyzed
        ipcManager - The IPC manager to use for modeling inter-component and inter-application data flows

      • SetupApplication

        public SetupApplication(InfoflowAndroidConfiguration config,
                        soot.jimple.infoflow.ipc.IIPCManager ipcManager)
        Creates a new instance of the SetupApplication class
        Parameters:
        config - The data flow configuration to use
        ipcManager - The IPC manager to use for modelling inter-component and inter-application data flows

    • Method Detail

      • getSinks

        public Set<soot.jimple.infoflow.sourcesSinks.definitions.SourceSinkDefinition> getSinks()
        Gets the set of sinks loaded into FlowDroid These are the sinks as they are defined through the SourceSinkManager.
        Returns:
        The set of sinks loaded into FlowDroid

      • getCollectedSinks

        public Set<soot.jimple.Stmt> getCollectedSinks()
        Gets the concrete instances of sinks that have been collected inside the app. This method returns null if source and sink logging has not been enabled (see InfoflowConfiguration.setLogSourcesAndSinks()).
        Returns:
        The set of concrete sink instances in the app

      • printSinks

        public void printSinks()
        Prints the list of sinks registered with FlowDroud to stdout

      • getSources

        public Set<soot.jimple.infoflow.sourcesSinks.definitions.SourceSinkDefinition> getSources()
        Gets the set of sources loaded into FlowDroid. These are the sources as they are defined through the SourceSinkManager.
        Returns:
        The set of sources loaded into FlowDroid

      • getCollectedSources

        public Set<soot.jimple.Stmt> getCollectedSources()
        Gets the concrete instances of sources that have been collected inside the app. This method returns null if source and sink logging has not been enabled (see InfoflowConfiguration.setLogSourcesAndSinks()).
        Returns:
        The set of concrete source instances in the app

      • printSources

        public void printSources()
        Prints the list of sources registered with FlowDroud to stdout

      • printEntrypoints

        public void printEntrypoints()
        Prints list of classes containing entry points to stdout

      • setCallbackClasses

        public void setCallbackClasses(Set<String> callbackClasses)
        Sets the class names of callbacks. If this value is null, it automatically loads the names from AndroidCallbacks.txt as the default behavior.
        Parameters:
        callbackClasses - The class names of callbacks or null to use the default file.

      • getCallbackClasses

        public Set<String> getCallbackClasses()

      • setTaintWrapper

        public void setTaintWrapper(soot.jimple.infoflow.taintWrappers.ITaintPropagationWrapper taintWrapper)
        Sets the taint wrapper to be used for propagating taints over unknown (library) callees. If this value is null, no taint wrapping is used.
        Parameters:
        taintWrapper - The taint wrapper to use or null to disable taint wrapping

      • getTaintWrapper

        public soot.jimple.infoflow.taintWrappers.ITaintPropagationWrapper getTaintWrapper()
        Gets the taint wrapper to be used for propagating taints over unknown (library) callees. If this value is null, no taint wrapping is used.
        Returns:
        The taint wrapper to use or null if taint wrapping is disabled

      • createLayoutFileParser

        protected LayoutFileParser createLayoutFileParser()
        Creates a new layout file parser. Derived classes can override this method to supply their own parser.
        Returns:
        The newly created layout file parser.

      • createSourceSinkManager

        protected soot.jimple.infoflow.sourcesSinks.manager.ISourceSinkManager createSourceSinkManager(LayoutFileParser lfp,
                                                                                               Set<CallbackDefinition> callbacks)
        Creates an instance of ISourceSinkManager that defines what FlowDorid shall consider as a source or sink, respectively.
        Parameters:
        lfp - The parser that handles the layout XML files
        callbacks - The callbacks that have been collected so far
        Returns:
        The new source sink manager

      • getSourceSinkManager

        public soot.jimple.infoflow.sourcesSinks.manager.ISourceSinkManager getSourceSinkManager()
        Gets the source/sink manager constructed for FlowDroid. Make sure to call calculateSourcesSinksEntryPoints() first, or you will get a null result.
        Returns:
        FlowDroid's source/sink manager

      • constructCallgraph

        public void constructCallgraph()
        Constructs a callgraph only without running the actual data flow analysis. If you want to run a data flow analysis, do not call this method. Instead, call runInfoflow() directly, which will take care all necessary prerequisites.

      • runInfoflow

        public soot.jimple.infoflow.results.InfoflowResults runInfoflow(Set<AndroidMethod> sources,
                                                                Set<AndroidMethod> sinks)
                                                         throws IOException,
                                                                org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException
        Runs the data flow analysis.
        Parameters:
        sources - The methods that shall be considered as sources
        sinks - The methods that shall be considered as sinks
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the given source/sink file could not be read.
        org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException - Thrown if the Android manifest file could not be read.

      • runInfoflow

        public soot.jimple.infoflow.results.InfoflowResults runInfoflow(String sourceSinkFile)
                                                         throws IOException,
                                                                org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException
        Runs the data flow analysis.
        Parameters:
        sourceSinkFile - The full path and file name of the file containing the sources and sinks
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the given source/sink file could not be read.
        org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException - Thrown if the Android manifest file could not be read.

      • runInfoflow

        public soot.jimple.infoflow.results.InfoflowResults runInfoflow()
                                                         throws IOException,
                                                                org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException
        Runs the data flow analysis.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the given source/sink file could not be read.
        org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException - Thrown if the Android manifest file could not be read.

      • runInfoflow

        public soot.jimple.infoflow.results.InfoflowResults runInfoflow(soot.jimple.infoflow.sourcesSinks.definitions.ISourceSinkDefinitionProvider sourcesAndSinks)
        Runs the data flow analysis.
        Parameters:
        sourcesAndSinks - The sources and sinks of the data flow analysis
        Returns:
        The results of the data flow analysis

      • getDummyMainMethod

        public soot.SootMethod getDummyMainMethod()
        Gets the dummy main method that was used for the last callgraph construction. You need to run a data flow analysis or call constructCallgraph() first, otherwise you will get a null result.
        Returns:
        The dummy main method

      • getSootConfig

        public soot.jimple.infoflow.config.IInfoflowConfig getSootConfig()
        Gets the extra Soot configuration options to be used when running the analysis
        Returns:
        The extra Soot configuration options to be used when running the analysis, null if the defaults shall be used

      • setSootConfig

        public void setSootConfig(soot.jimple.infoflow.config.IInfoflowConfig config)
        Sets the extra Soot configuration options to be used when running the analysis
        Parameters:
        config - The extra Soot configuration options to be used when running the analysis, null if the defaults shall be used

      • setIcfgFactory

        public void setIcfgFactory(soot.jimple.infoflow.cfg.BiDirICFGFactory factory)
        Sets the factory class to be used for constructing interprocedural control flow graphs
        Parameters:
        factory - The factory to be used. If null is passed, the default factory is used.

      • getMaxMemoryConsumption

        public long getMaxMemoryConsumption()
        Gets the maximum memory consumption during the last analysis run
        Returns:
        The maximum memory consumption during the last analysis run if available, otherwise -1

      • getConfig

        public InfoflowAndroidConfiguration getConfig()
        Gets the data flow configuration
        Returns:
        The current data flow configuration

        public void setCallbackFile(String callbackFile)

      • addPreprocessor

        public void addPreprocessor(soot.jimple.infoflow.handlers.PreAnalysisHandler preprocessor)
        Adds custom code to be executed before the taint propagation starts
        Parameters:
        preprocessor - The callback to invoke before starting the taint propagation

      • addResultsAvailableHandler

        public void addResultsAvailableHandler(soot.jimple.infoflow.handlers.ResultsAvailableHandler handler)
        Adds a new handler that shall be executed when the results of the data flow analysis are available
        Parameters:
        handler - The callback to invoke when the data flow results are available

      • abortAnalysis

        public void abortAnalysis()
        Aborts the data flow analysis. This is useful when the analysis controller is running in a different thread and the main thread (e.g., a GUI) wants to abort the analysis

      • setIpcManager

        public void setIpcManager(soot.jimple.infoflow.ipc.IIPCManager ipcManager)
        Sets the IPC manager for modeling inter-component and inter-application data flows
        Parameters:
        ipcManager - The IPC manager to use for modeling inter-component and inter-application data flows

      • setTaintPropagationHandler

        public void setTaintPropagationHandler(soot.jimple.infoflow.handlers.TaintPropagationHandler taintPropagationHandler)
        Sets the taint propagation handler, which will be notified when the data flow analysis processes an edge. Use this callback if you need a hook into the low-level data flow analysis.
        Parameters:
        taintPropagationHandler - The propagation handler to register

      • setValueProvider

        public void setValueProvider(soot.jimple.infoflow.values.IValueProvider valueProvider)
        Sets the value provider that extracts constants from the Jimple code
        Parameters:
        valueProvider - The value provider for extracting constants from the code
